Job Title: Writer Scientific Innovation

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Research, Science

Description:
Writer, Scientific Innovation (SI)Reports to: SI Director
The SI Writer creates scientifically sound, clinically relevant, and strategically positioned content for healthcare professionals through various communication channels. With a passion for science, they can distill complex information into impactful learning. This individual has outstanding interpersonal skills to collaborate with clients, healthcare professionals, and internal cross-functional teams.
Essential FunctionsBuild scientific deliverables (eg, presentations, client reports, manuscripts, posters, and abstracts) by applying expert skills in MS Word and PowerPointPerform literature reviews and searchesWrite reports and summaries from notesCheck references and create reference packs Support SI Directors in strategic evaluation and recommendationsMaintain medical, legal, and regulatory project aspects Maintain current client relationshipsDevelop relationships with faculty advisors through collaboration on publications, advisory board meetings, and speaker training initiatives Support client work by traveling to live events and meetings (approximately 20%)Perform other duties as assigned to support project work
CompetenciesTo be successful in a position, an individual must not only perform the essential functions of the job but also demonstrate expertise. The following are essential to success: 
Exemplification of FORCE attributes: This is the essence of FORCE. Every member of the team embodies these characteristics. These attributes include passion for success, accountability, sound judgment, adaptability, professionalism, creativity/innovation, ethical work with integrity, quality, and caringExcellent/intermediate communication skills: The ability to communicate effectively is vital to success. These skills include speaking and writing clearly and effectively balancing listening and speaking in conversations and meetings, and presenting effectively to the needs of the intended audienceExcellent/intermediate relationship management skills: Relationship management centers on an individual’s ability to manage interactions to provide service and to support the organization. These skills include being attentive to the customer’s needs, collaborating with teammates, demonstrating the ability to influence, identifying and solving problems, and working through conflict by encouraging open communication
Required Education and/or ExperienceAn advanced science or clinical degree (PharmD preferred) Scientific understanding and expertise Experience in medical research, medical education, pharmaceutical writing, or medical writing helpful but willing to train the right candidate
Client interaction and customer service are integral to this role. Periodic travel (local, national, or international) to client sites or events may be required.
Standard working hours are based on US Eastern time.
LocationQualified candidates must be legally authorized for employment in the US, as our organization does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status for this position. We participate in E-Verify and are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
FORCE Communications is a full-service medical marketing, communications, and education organization founded in 2001 that specializes in creating unique scientific/Medical Affairs, medicalcommunications/education, commercial, and payer solutions. Our organization specializes in collaborating with pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device, and healthcare providers and industry partners in developing innovative programs that integrate scientific information with industry/healthcare market insight and adult learning principles.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
